channel.title: Aleksandar Todorović
channel.description: Student. Hacker. Open Source Advocate. Opensource.com Community Moderator

item.title: Flasback: My First Programming Project That Went Viral
item.description: A month ago, the owner of DJ TechTools (called Ean Golden) released a video where he told the history of DJ TechTools. Now, I decided to share my story about DJ TechTools with you.

item.title: Simple way to integrate social media links into Jekyll website
item.description: I saw this error happening over and over in a lot of places. People do not integrate their social links using Jekyll. Instead, they hard code them into HTML code. Well, there’s a better way and it’s pretty simple.

item.title: My elementary OS Workflow
item.description: In this post, I’m going to share with you my workflow and my experience with apps developed specifically for elementary OS. Unfortunately, I’m not very impressed with the state of apps designed specifically for elementary OS right now, but I do think that the situation will improve by the end of the year.

item.title: Announcing Partnership with Opensource.com
item.description: As of June 1st, I became a Community Moderator for the Red Hat supported brand called Opensource.com. As such, I made a one year long commitment to provide content for the site on a regular basis.

item.title: How NOT to Behave When You Get Pulled Over by a Police Officer in a Foreign Country
item.description: I know that we live in a shitty part of the world. But getting pulled over by a police officer and suggesting that he requested a bribe from you simply because you misunderstood him is a new level of being a huge douchebag.

item.title: How awesome GitHub lists are making GitHub even more awesome!
item.description: GitHub is growing out of the place where you just share your code to something bigger for a while now. Of course, GitHub is still an awesome place to share your code, but there’s more to it. Way more.

item.title: On Open Source Advocacy
item.description: What does it mean to be an open source advocate? Can I really make a difference? How do I do that? There are so many questions about the Open Source Advocacy and, surprisingly, so little answers available.

item.title: Basic Facebook Hacks – Where were my friends while they were texting me?
item.description: Have you ever seen movies or read books about Harry Potter? If you did, then you might be familiar with the term Marauder’s Map. If you’re not a Harry Potter fan or the term doesn’t ring a bell, here’s a one minute video that will explain the basic concept to you:

item.title: Debunking the Myths of Terrorism
item.description: You’re probably wondering what the hell is a post about terrorism doing on a primarily IT oriented blog? Well, I got interested in the term cyber terrorism. I want learn more about this term: is cyber terrorism possible, how to fight against it, etc.

item.title: Back to Basics - Books, Vinyls and Notebooks
item.description: If you have read any of my previous posts, you probably know that I’m a huge workaholic. I like to learn something new every single day, I like to explore different things and I’m a huge fan of reading books and listening to music.
